comment: Free tasting from the owner of Valkyrie
Very sweet for rye. Super smooth.
amber , clear, no sediments, light, delicate smell, vanilla smell, taste is sweet, candy, honey, with hints of clove, black pepper
8 year old Buster's Liquor & Wine exclusive cask strength version. 113.2 proof.
Very nice, full rye. Spicy with smooth afternotes. A new fave.
Deep rye. Burns good. Notes of Carmel sage and camo fire. Smells like  pockles
Sweet and spicy like the perfect Rye should be. Best one I've tasted. Definitely worth the $$
Smooth Ambler is one of my new favorites. Both their bourbon and rye are excellent for mid $30's. 4 stars!
Spicy. Long finish. Bit of burn!
Had this at Liberty in Seattle, WA. Really enjoyed it actually. You don't see it at most bars, but when you do it's definitely worth a try. I should try it again soon...
One of the best rye whiskeys I have had so far. Really smooth, light on the spice (but not a whimp). My go to rye!
Purchased in February 2015 for $35. Last tasting at Mike Massinople's in February 2015. Great tasting rye with sweet overtones for the price.
Very spicy with long a burning finish.
The spice is amazing!  I love the notes of Carmel and cinnamon
Really nice rye, great layers of baking spice, slight hit of mint chased through with bits of sweet dessert flavors.  Pretty smooth for 99 proof and better than some other similar priced whiskies.
If you like extremely spicy rye, this is for you. I don't, so not for me.
This is one of the best rye's I've ever had. VERY spicy, bit of Apple & vanilla, but all told just a great rye with a rich full body. Outstanding.

My absolute favorite right now.  The nose is like an old library.  Old wood and sweet leather.  On the tongue, the same, with a little brown sugar.  The finish has a dill note.  Not dill pickle, but herbal dill.  It doesn't sound good, but it is amazing!
4 stars - Smooth and spicy, almost peppery, but still plenty of sweetness.  The finish is full on rye bread, and a little bit of fruitiness. Very little burn and a little dry.
Floral and incredibly smooth for a rye.
Nice bite to this one. Gives me a heartburn gels as is goes down.

Blind tasting sample from Aaron Stark. 

Nose: pencils and graphite open up to vanilla and new oak. Furniture polish opens up to caramel corn
Palate: horseradish at first quickly diffused to light caramel, cream, corn, and then spearmint. Medium silky texture. Not much heat to the mid-palate. Sweet. 
Finish:
Warmth escalates then quickly fades, leaving a bitter and dry burnt sugar sensation atop a light syrup coating. Pink peppercorn.
Deep rich nose, a bit of Cola. Tastes of cola as well, floral notes with a bit of bitterness. Spice is mild but hits at the back of the throat. Pleasant. 10/16/17
Sweet nose with mild spice. Mild sweet flavor  with hints of spice. Sweet fiish with spice and a touch of oak. Batch 56, bottle date 2/12/15. Thanks JT.
Has an awesome feel from the moment it touches your lips to the time it's fumes vacate the back of your throat. Flavors are a bit subdued, but the experience more than makes up for it...
Grassy and spicy, rich flavors but light body with some ethanol heat. MGPI sourced.
